poem:
### A Slice of Discord

In Norwich streets, a battle brews  
over pineapple rings—a taste taboo.  
Chefs levy a tax on sweet delight;  
the dough is tossed in morning light.  
Pies that fuel this passion alive,  
flavor by flavor, the town's divide.  
O, what wars brew for tongues that dare,  
to challenge taste, with fruits they bear.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Norwich pizza chefs are waging war over pineapple. But they’re just the latest to put a tax on taste | Van Badham Forget Greenland. A UK pizzeria, Lupa Pizza in Norwich, rendered itself the No 1 place on earth most deserving of hostile annexation this week when it announced a “taste tax” on one of its offerings. In the past, wars have been provoked by a pig, cod, bird droppings, a bucket, someone’s ear and". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
